t: Luke 14
A Man with Dropsy Healed on the Sabbath
Now*p it happened, as He went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees to eat bread on the Sabbath, that they watched Him closely.
And behold, there was a certain man before Him who had dropsy.
And Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying, “Is*r it*r lawful*r to*r heal*r on*r the*r Sabbath?”*r
But*p they kept silent. And He took him*i and healed him, and let him go.

Then He answered them, saying, “Which*r of*r you,*r having*r a*r donkey*r or*r an*r ox*r that*r has*r fallen*r into*r a*r pit,*r will*r not*r immediately*r pull*r him*r out*r on*r the*r Sabbath*r day?”*r
And they could not answer Him regarding these things.
Take the Lowly Place
So*p He told a parable to those who were invited, when He noted how they chose the best places, saying to them:
“When*r you*r are*r invited*r by*r anyone*r to*r a*r wedding*r feast,*r do*r not*r sit*r down*r in*r the*r best*r place,*r lest*r one*r more*r honorable*r than*r you*r be*r invited*r by*r him;*r
and*r he*r who*r invited*r you*r and*r him*r come*r and*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘Give*r place*r to*r this*r man,’*r and*r then*r you*r begin*r with*r shame*r to*r take*r the*r lowest*r place.*r

But*r when*r you*r are*r invited,*r go*r and*r sit*r down*r in*r the*r lowest*r place,*r so*r that*r when*r he*r who*r invited*r you*r comes*r he*r may*r say*r to*r you,*r ‘Friend,*r go*r up*r higher.’*r Then*r you*r will*r have*r glory*r in*r the*r presence*r of*r those*r who*r sit*r at*r the*r table*r with*r you.*r
For*r whoever*r exalts*r himself*r will*r be*r humbled,*r and*r he*r who*r humbles*r himself*r will*r be*r exalted.”*r

Then*p He also said to him who invited Him, “When*r you*r give*r a*r dinner*r or*r a*r supper,*r do*r not*r ask*r your*r friends,*r your*r brothers,*r your*r relatives,*r nor*r rich*r neighbors,*r lest*r they*r also*r invite*r you*r back,*r and*r you*r be*r repaid.*r
But*r when*r you*r give*r a*r feast,*r invite*r the*ir poor,*r the*ir maimed,*r the*ir lame,*r the*ir blind.*r
And*r you*r will*r be*r blessed,*r because*r they*r cannot*r repay*r you;*r for*r you*r shall*r be*r repaid*r at*r the*r resurrection*r of*r the*r just.”*r
The Parable of the Great Supper
Now*p when one of those who sat at the table with Him heard these things, he said to Him, “Blessed is*i he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God!”
Then*p He said to him, “A*r certain*r man*r gave*r a*r great*r supper*r and*r invited*r many,*r
and*r sent*r his*r servant*r at*r supper*r time*r to*r say*r to*r those*r who*r were*r invited,*r ‘Come,*r for*r all*r things*r are*r now*r ready.’*r

But*r they*r all*r with*r one*r accord*ir began*r to*r make*r excuses.*r The*r first*r said*r to*r him,*r ‘I*r have*r bought*r a*r piece*r of*r ground,*r and*r I*r must*r go*r and*r see*r it.*r I*r ask*r you*r to*r have*r me*r excused.’*r
And*r another*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r bought*r five*r yoke*r of*r oxen,*r and*r I*r am*r going*r to*r test*r them.*r I*r ask*r you*r to*r have*r me*r excused.’*r
Still*r another*r said,*r ‘I*r have*r married*r a*r wife,*r and*r therefore*r I*r cannot*r come.’*r

So*r that*r servant*r came*r and*r reported*r these*r things*r to*r his*r master.*r Then*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house,*r being*r angry,*r said*r to*r his*r servant,*r ‘Go*r out*r quickly*r into*r the*r streets*r and*r lanes*r of*r the*r city,*r and*r bring*r in*r here*r the*ir poor*r and*r the*ir maimed*r and*r the*ir lame*r and*r the*ir blind.’*r
And*r the*r servant*r said,*r ‘Master,*r it*r is*r done*r as*r you*r commanded,*r and*r still*r there*r is*r room.’*r
Then*r the*r master*r said*r to*r the*r servant,*r ‘Go*r out*r into*r the*r highways*r and*r hedges,*r and*r compel*r them*ir to*r come*r in,*r that*r my*r house*r may*r be*r filled.*r
For*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r none*r of*r those*r men*r who*r were*r invited*r shall*r taste*r my*r supper.’”*r
Leaving All to Follow Christ
Now*p great multitudes went with Him. And He turned and said to them,

“If*r anyone*r comes*r to*r Me*r and*r does*r not*r hate*r his*r father*r and*r mother,*r wife*r and*r children,*r brothers*r and*r sisters,*r yes,*r and*r his*r own*r life*r also,*r he*r cannot*r be*r My*r disciple.*r
And*r whoever*r does*r not*r bear*r his*r cross*r and*r come*r after*r Me*r cannot*r be*r My*r disciple.*r
For*r which*r of*r you,*r intending*r to*r build*r a*r tower,*r does*r not*r sit*r down*r first*r and*r count*r the*r cost,*r whether*r he*r has*r enough*ir to*r finish*r it—*ir
lest,*r after*r he*r has*r laid*r the*r foundation,*r and*r is*r not*r able*r to*r finish,*r all*r who*r see*r it*ir begin*r to*r mock*r him,*r
saying,*r ‘This*r man*r began*r to*r build*r and*r was*r not*r able*r to*r finish’?*r

Or*r what*r king,*r going*r to*r make*r war*r against*r another*r king,*r does*r not*r sit*r down*r first*r and*r consider*r whether*r he*r is*r able*r with*r ten*r thousand*r to*r meet*r him*r who*r comes*r against*r him*r with*r twenty*r thousand?*r
Or*r else,*r while*r the*r other*r is*r still*r a*r great*r way*r off,*r he*r sends*r a*r delegation*r and*r asks*r conditions*r of*r peace.*r
So*r likewise,*r whoever*r of*r you*r does*r not*r forsake*r all*r that*r he*r has*r cannot*r be*r My*r disciple.*r
Tasteless Salt Is Worthless
“Salt*rp is*ir good;*r but*r if*r the*r salt*r has*r lost*r its*r flavor,*r how*r shall*r it*r be*r seasoned?*r
It*r is*r neither*r fit*r for*r the*r land*r nor*r for*r the*r dunghill,*r but*ir men*r throw*r it*r out.*r He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!”*r
